timerutil.py¶

Timer utility functions for Hylaa. Timers are used for performance analysis and can be statically referred to using Timers.tic(name) and Timers.toc(name)

class hylaa.timerutil.TimerData(name, parent)¶

Performance timer object which can be started with the tic() method and paused with toc() method

  • Each TimerData object contains of list of TimerData children known as descendents

full_name()¶

Returns the full name of the timer (including ancestors)

Returns

full string description of timer

Return type

str

get_child(name)¶

Get a child timer with the given name

Parameters

name – name

Returns

descendent TimerData object

Return type

TimerData

get_children_recursive(name)¶

Get all TimerData decendants with the given name.

Parameters

name – name

Returns

list of TimerData objects

Return type

list

tic()¶

Start the timer. Utilizes the time module to track elapsed time.

toc()¶

Stop the timer. Add elapsed time to counter of total number of seconds.

  • Note: Timer must be started with the tic() method beforehand.

class hylaa.timerutil.Timers¶

A static class for doing time measurements.

static print_stats()¶

Print statistics about TimerData objects to stdout

static print_stats_recursive(td, level, total_time)¶

Recursively print information about a timer

Parameters

  • td (TimerData) – timer object

  • level – level of recursion

  • total_time –

static reset()¶

Reset all timers

static tic(name)¶

Starts a timer with a specific name. If such a timer doesn’t exist, create it and push it into the stack.

Parameters

name – name of timer

static toc(name)¶

Stop a timer with a specific name

Parameters

name – name of timer

hylaa
